Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder section of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, with base of one handle surviving, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394240) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394240)
